algorithm_technique: Sort the array and consider changing the smallest or largest elements to minimize the score.
problem_summary_simple: Minimize the sum of max and min absolute differences by changing two elements.
problem_summary_technical: Sort the array. The minimum score is achieved by making the three smallest or three largest elements equal, or by making two elements equal to a value between the smallest and largest.
key_insights: The score is (max_val - min_val) + (max_diff - min_diff). To minimize this, we want to minimize both max_val - min_val and max_diff - min_diff.
Sorting the array helps identify the smallest and largest elements.

By changing two elements, we can effectively make three elements equal. The minimum score is achieved by making the three smallest, three largest, or two smallest/largest and one middle element equal.
